result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling conference on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.

2:19 PM Defendant Lindsey LRJ Sukowaty appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared in court for Lindsey LRJ Sukowaty, Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Inducement: Letter dated February 14, not reviewed with the defendant
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Offer deadline is set for March 18, 2022 at 8:30 a.m. 
BOND MOTION
Defense is asking for a signature bond. State objects to modification. Court denies the motion. State to draft the order.
Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:16 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Lindsey LRJ Sukowaty appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Carl Knepel appeared in court for Lindsey LRJ Sukowaty. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lindsey LRJ Sukowaty
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-03-2022)
Prior: 1212 S 11Th St C, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 01-29-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine, felony bail jumping and possess Fentanyl.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-07-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the condition that she not possess any controlled substance.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
